Personally I feel it's less about tolerating trolls and more about understanding that people are different and will play differently. You say yourself you like to play off-meta. Many people would label you a troll because you aren't playing the way they expect you to, but trolling implies you aren't trying to win to the very best of your ability.

That's not to say there aren't any trolls, because there are, and in online gaming encountering them is pretty inevitable, but I've also seen people label someone as a troll simply because they did something that person didn't feel was the best course of action, even if both options were equally valid.

Remember that basically everyone thinks they are right, and oftentimes, especially in something as subjective as a League game, there can be more than one right answer. 

People aren't going to trust a stranger's word or play choice unless they already agree with it, or you give them a good reason to (sound reasoning or proven success). 

Of course, even then, people can be very stuck in their ways, and if they aren't open to change, there's absolutely zilch a random stranger can do about it. If they're convinced they're 100% right and there's no other way to do something, they will find ways to prove you wrong no matter how sound your logic or how proven your success.

I guess ultimately my point is, there will always be some things out of your control. Other thinking creatures are going to be high on that list. Focus on what you can control, and don't get bogged down by the stuff you really can't, and you'll have much better games and experiences in general.

Packet loss (the pause then jump, rather than regular delay) is just another type of connection issue. It can also easily be caused by an issue between you and the League servers (think ISP type issues) rather than at one end or the other. If it's nothing on your end, checking your ISPs service status page is always a good and easy next step.

The chance of it being caused by another player is basically nil. It's not technically *impossible*, but practically speaking it may as well be. It would probably be easier for them to compromise your account and get it banned, which assuming you're safe with your passwords and don't share the account, also doesn't fall anywhere close to the category of "easy".

Threats (or allusions to) on the other hand are taken very seriously, and if you are concerned you can pass the report on to player support for evaluation. Could be nothing, and just someone who thinks it's funny (which it totally isn't), but serious threats can end in law enforcement getting involved.
